displaytitle: Mosaic plaque: Mask of an old man
medium: Opaque white, yellow, black/purple glass on opaque red background

titles.title: Mosaic plaque: Mask of an old man

texts.textentryhtml: Purchased by the Museum in October 1951 from the Robert Garrett Collection, sold at Kende Galleries, lot no. 64

Entire comic mask of a slave depicted in three-quarter view on red background. Yellow face on which features are rendered with brown, black, and gray lines, while the striated hair and beard are made of white and grayish glass. Gray and black wavy wrinkles on the forehead; a similar line denotes the eyebrows. Big white eyes outlined with fine black lines, with black pupils outlined in red. Two red and gray rectangles above the nose between the eyes. Fine black lines render the short,
wide nose; brown wrinkles on the cheeks; open, semicircular black mouth, outlined in red. A few locks of hair extend below the main part of the hair.
